description: Try our easy to follow Mandarin Brulee recipe. Absolutely delicious with the best ingredients from Woolworths.
name: Mandarin Brulee Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Remove peel from 1 mandarin using a vegetable peeler. Halve all the mandarins and juice. You will need 1 cup of juice. Place juice into a small saucepan with peel. Bring to the boil and add 1 tbs of the caster sugar. Boil juice until syrupy and reduced to 2 tbs.

Meanwhile place egg yolks, remaining sugar and vanilla into a bowl. Whisk until smooth. Pour reduced juice into a small jug and cool slightly. Add cream to the same pan with peel, stirring well to dissolve any remaining syrup. Bring to boiling point then whisk into egg yolk mixture and discard peel.

Preheat oven to 150°C. Lay a tea towel in the base of a baking dish. Sit 4x150ml ramekins on a towel. Pour enough boiling water into baking dish to come halfway up the sides of the ramekins. Divide cream mixture between ramekins and cover baking dish loosely with foil. Bake for 40 minutes until just set. Remove from baking dish and refrigerate for 3 hours.
Preheat grill on high. Sprinkle top of each brulee with demerara sugar. Grill until sugar has melted and turned to toffee. Serve brulees with extra mandarin segments.
